intro: Ditassa bifurcata, commonly known as the forked leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive bifurcated leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, humid areas. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
